message: Happy New Year--hoping everyone has a happy, healthy, and prosperous 2017.

I had the great privilege over the weekend of presenting Hamburg resident and Afghanistan War veteran, Sgt. James E. Cutting, with the Purple Heart. Sgt. Cutting served as a member of the 307th Military Police Company’s 3rd Platoon 2nd Squad from 2011-2012. On October 16, 2011, Sgt. Cutting suffered a traumatic brain injury after a RPG detonated on his vehicle. Thank you to Hamburg Town Supervisor Steven Walters, Erie County Legislator Lynne Dixon, members of Hamburg VFW Post 1419, and Sgt. Cutting’s friends and family who came together to show our sincere appreciation for Sgt. Cutting’s tremendous service and sacrifice on behalf of our nation.

Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, and as a small gesture of appreciation, a blue light will be turned on in my Washington office to show support for the brave men and women in blue.  Last year, 135 law enforcement officers paid the ultimate sacrifice while protecting members of the communities they serve—the highest total in five years and a 10% increase from 2015. In order to create a safer America, our law enforcement officers put the risks associated with their duty aside and continue to serve honorably. On behalf of the residents throughout New York’s 27th Congressional District and the country, thank you for regularly putting our safety and well-being ahead of your own.

Back in November, the hardworking residents of Western New York sent Washington a clear message: their interests and values will no longer be ignored. Residents throughout New York's 27th Congressional District can be assured that their voices have been heard. I am proud to be the Congressional Liaison to the Trump Transition, and I will continue working alongside my House colleagues to ensure the issues that matter most to Western New Yorker's will be well represented throughout the next administration.  http://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/politics/albany/2017/01/12/trump-new-york-rural/96445434/

To the families of Flight 3407, your strong advocacy efforts to ensure that no one endures a tragedy of this magnitude again will not be undone. As your Congressman, I will support the reauthorization of the 2010 airline safety reforms and will fight against any attempts to water down these crucial airline safety standards.  http://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/2017/01/12/flight-3407-families/96510902/

Americans across the country are witnessing President Trump deliver on his promise to put America first and take back our stolen jobs. Western New Yorkers know all too well the failures of poorly negotiated free trade agreements. Our shuttered factories and decimated population are daily reminders that there is a vast difference between free trade and fair trade. Western New York’s middle class is rejoicing that we now have a president who backs up his rhetoric with actions to protect American jobs.   http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/23/trump-signs-executive-order-withdrawing-us-from-tpp-trade-deal.html

I applaud the executive actions taken by President Trump yesterday to block foreign aid or federal funding for international nongovernmental organizations that promote abortions. I am a proud cosponsor of H.R. 7, which aims to prohibit taxpayer funded abortions, and I look forward to working together with President Trump to protect the life of the unborn and our most vulnerable.

Honored to have the support of Congressman Blake Farenthold (R-TX), Congressman Walter B. Jones (R-NC), and U.S. Senator John Cornyn (R-TX) in keeping wind turbines away from our military installations. The “Protection of Military Airfields from Wind Turbines Encroachment Act” will help deter clean energy companies from installing massive wind turbines in close proximity to military bases like the Niagara Falls Air Reserve Station. I will remain committed to protecting our national security investments and ensuring the future viability of our military bases.  https://buffalonews.com/2017/01/24/collins-bill-hamper-lake-ontario-wind-project/

ICYMI: Great story about Dorothy Gregory-Watkins, a former Lockport resident and Congressional Gold Medal recipient. At just nine years old, Dorothy began taking flying lessons and continued to develop her aviation skills throughout her life, eventually earning the rank of second lieutenant in the Civil Air Patrol’s Kenmore Squadron 2. As a member of the Civil Air Patrol from 1942 to 1949, Dorothy performed local search-and-rescue missions and helped ensure military supplies were delivered safely across the Great Lakes during WWII.  http://www.lockportjournal.com/news/local_news/before-her-time-lockport-woman-receives-congressional-gold-medal-posthumously/article_5d08b41c-a3fb-561e-ac44-cf1c6642bcdd.html

I am proud to announce that over $170 million in federal funds will be delivered to New York to improve broadband access in our rural communities. This crucial funding could have been sent to other states, but we fought to ensure  this critical investment would be made in New York. This is great news for Western New Yorkers, and I’d like to thank Senator Schumer and Governor Cuomo for joining together to improve the lives of New Yorkers.

President Trump’s executive action to require federal agencies to eliminate at least two regulations for each new one issued is great news for small business owners in Western New York. For too long, overbearing and complex federal regulations have prevented our region’s entrepreneurs from expanding and developing their business. Small business owners can finally focus their energy on creating jobs—not complying with outdated, bureaucratic red-tape.   http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/30/trump-signs-executive-order-to-drastically-cut-federal-regs.html

Tonight, President Trump will announce his nominee for the United States Supreme Court. It is a shame that Senate Democrats are already considering putting partisan politics ahead of country by ignoring the will of the American people and filibustering the appointment. Almost three months ago, Americans sent Washington a clear message: it is time appoint a United States Supreme Court Justice who embodies the conservative principles and values of the late Justice Antonin Scalia.  http://www.politico.com/story/2017/01/donald-trump-supreme-court-progressives-234397

Proud of the recent bill proposed in the NYS legislature that would rule offenses committed against our first responders at hate crimes. Our first responders deserve the full support of the communities they protect. This legislation would make it clear that New York State does not tolerate any act of violence against our first responders. Looking forward to seeing this bipartisan legislation signed by Governor Cuomo.   http://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/politics/albany/2017/01/30/ny-seeks-hate-crime-law-attacks-first-responders/97253818/

President Trump showed America his commitment to conservative principles with last night's Supreme Court nomination. Judge Neil Gorsuch will be a strong voice on the Court for years to come. I fully anticipate that he will continue interpreting laws as they are written and defend the constitutionally protected rights all Americans hold dear. I urge my Democrat colleagues in the Senate to recognize the clear message American voters sent on Election Day and quickly confirm Judge Gorsuch.

I joined the “NY Needs Uber Coalition” in 2015 because I believe all Western New York residents deserve access to the same opportunities and technology as NYC residents and the majority of Americans. Delivering ride-sharing services to our region will create thousands of job opportunities and bring us into the 21st Century. I’d like to thank NYS Assemblyman Ray Walter for standing up for Western New York and introducing legislation at the state level that will make ride-sharing services available statewide.   http://buffalonews.com/2017/01/31/another-voice-ridesharing-services-will-boost-wny-economy/?utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=puma&utm_source=Twitter&utm_term=Autofeed#link_time=1485899463

The first of eight KC-135 tanker planes arrived at the Niagara Falls Air Reserve Station (NFARS)—marking the start of the 914th Airlift Wing’s new refueling mission. I will continue to fight to secure missions like these are brought to NFARS. This is a great investment in our national security and the base’s future viability.    http://buffalonews.com/2017/02/01/first-new-tanker-planes-arrives-niagara-falls-air-base/

I’d like to thank the families of Flight 3407 who traveled to Washington yesterday for a roundtable discussion with our Western New York delegation and leaders of the House Aviation Subcommittee. Over the last eight years, your relentless advocacy to deliver safer skies for all Americans has brought about tremendous improvements to our aviation safety standards. I stand with you, and remain committed to ensuring these hard fought safeguards stay in place.

The United States has been appeasing foreign adversaries like Iran for too long. The sanctions imposed by President Trump today demonstrate that the U.S. will not tolerate Iran’s continued support for terrorism and inability to abide by nuclear and ballistic testing restrictions. These sanctions strongly reinforce the current administration’s stance—the United States will stand against any countries that promote these destabilizing actions.   http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/02/03/us-hits-13-people-dozen-companies-in-new-iran-sanctions.html
President Trump is already hard at work. Here’s a roundup of what President Trump accomplished in his second week in office to help Western New Yorkers and Americans across the country.
Today, we remember the life and legacy of a man who never failed to remind us that “America is too great for small dreams.” Happy birthday, President Reagan.

ICYMI: “Their bipartisan pledge highlights what the people in WNY have known for years - ensuring the long-term viability of the Niagara Air Reserve Station is a matter of common sense, not politics.” I’m proud to stand with Congressman Brian Higgins to protect our national security investments and ensure the future viability of the base.   http://www.niagara-gazette.com/opinion/editorial-another-sign-of-success-at-falls-air-base/article_061f6504-eaa8-11e6-9ab7-3b3154ed69bb.html

New York State Assembly Democrats yesterday passed a bill that would make New York a “sanctuary state.” This legislation demonstrates a complete disregard for our nation’s rule of law. When it comes enforcing federal immigration law, there is no room for political interpretation. The political leanings of elected officials should not determine which laws our state enforces and which laws our state neglects. We need to allow our law enforcement officers and federal immigration officials do their job and not let partisan elected officials continue to obstruct law and order in our country.    http://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2017/02/assembly-passes-sanctuary-state-bill-as-trump-response-109389

I am deeply saddened to hear about the passing of one of Western New York’s strongest ALS advocates, Michael Maloney. When Congress began crafting the 21st Century Cures Act, Michael reached out to ensure this legislation would fight to end ALS. In December, we celebrated the signing of the 21st Century Cures Act into law. Michael was an outstanding advocate and his efforts will help deliver a cure for ALS. I’m sending my thoughts and prayers to Michael’s family and friends today.

Public servants like our firefighters and first responders put their lives on the line every day for us. Unfortunately, studies show that firefighters see a higher rate of cancer than the rest of the general public. In order to combat this disturbing trend, I joined with Congressman Bill Pascrell, Jr. to introduce The Firefighter Cancer Registry Act, which will enable the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to create a national cancer registry to study the relationship between firefighters’ exposure to dangerous fumes and harmful toxins and the increased risk for several major cancers. We need to ensure this data is regularly updated, recorded and made available to the public so we can develop better safeguards for these brave men and women.   http://www.fireengineering.com/articles/2017/02/national-firefighter-cancer-registry.html

A cost efficient and sustainable infrastructure plan will drastically improve our region's economic development and tourism industry. Whether it’s renovating airport runways or our air traffic control systems, improvements to our airports will significantly boost travel throughout our region while creating thousands of jobs. It's great to see President Trump and Western New York airline executives coming together to discuss how we can revitalize our region’s aviation industry and infrastructure.    http://buffalonews.com/2017/02/09/buffalo-airport-chief-trump-aims-rebuild-airports/

Manufacturers in Western New York are hiring more workers and delivering more products to consumers than we’ve seen in years. It’s great to see our region’s manufacturing industry expand. As President Trump continues to put in place job creating policies and cut regulations, we’re going to start seeing this trend nationwide.   http://buffalonews.com/2017/02/10/local-manufacturers-start-2017-roll/

Our firefighters and first responders consistently put their lives on the line to keep our communities safe. Unfortunately studies are showing they face a higher risk of cancer when compared to the general population. My legislation would create a national cancer registry to study this deadly trend so we can provide better safeguards and protocols for these brave men and women. Thank you to the Firemen’s Association of the State of New York and the members of the Town of Batavia and Scranton Volunteer Fire Departments for joining me on Saturday to discuss how we can better preserve the health of our firefighters.   http://www.thelcn.com/lcn03/database-proposed-by-collins-would-track-cancer-among-firefighters-20170213

I am happy to see President Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau affirm their commitment to strengthening the U.S.-Canadian trade partnership. Between the U.S. and Canada, over $30 billion in bilateral trade is facilitated at the border crossings in New York each year. Canada has long been a valuable and respected trade partner to the U.S., and continuing to strengthen this relationship will undoubtedly benefit our region’s economy going forward.   https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/13/world/canada/justin-trudeau-donald-trump.html

After raising premiums and limiting exchange participation to only eleven states last year, Humana has now decided to completely withdraw from the Obamacare exchange in 2018. The fundamental failures of Obamacare have generated an unstable marketplace that is showing no signs of steadying. Obamacare left insurance companies and government bureaucrats in control of healthcare decisions—our replacement will provide greater access and more choices for patients.   http://www.cnbc.com/2017/02/14/humana-says-it-plans-to-pull-out-of-obamacare-exchanges-in-2018.html

Since the start of 2017, there have been significant increases in consumer spending, manufacturing production, and retail sales throughout the U.S. Now that we have an administration focused on scaling back excessive regulations and putting American workers first, we’re seeing a substantial boost in consumer and business confidence as well. I’m happy to see the U.S. economy growing and moving in the right direction.   https://www.wsj.com/articles/latest-data-signal-solid-momentum-for-u-s-economy-1487185467

Throughout Western New York, a significant number of roads, bridges, and airports are in need of renovation, but we cannot overlook how crucial it is to guarantee broadband access to all of our rural communities. The $170 million in federal funding that was secured last month will significantly help ensure every community throughout New York State can benefit from the economic and educational opportunities that broadband access can provide.  I am committed to working with President Trump to ensure his infrastructure plan includes rural broadband expansion so we can solve this problem once and for all and ensure no rural community is left behind.   http://www.thedailynewsonline.com/bdn06/digital-divide-trump-asked-to-put-broadband-expansion-in-infrastructure-plan-20170216

ICYMI: Great article about how Bob Capurso’s Bergen-based business, Legacy Markers, is honoring the community service of Boy Scout troop leaders throughout Western New York.   http://www.thedailynewsonline.com/bdn01/bergen-business-is-a-scouts-honor-20170217

ICYMI: My USA Today editorial on President Trump’s first month in office. President Trump is delivering on his promises, utilizing his skills as a CEO to deliver change in Washington, and returning the power of government back to the American people. I look forward to seeing President Trump continue to shatter the status quo and deliver positive results for all Americans.    http://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2017/02/19/president-trump-first-month-editorials-debates/98130490/

Western New Yorkers have significant concerns regarding the potential negative impact that massive wind turbines, like the 70 that may be built throughout Niagara County, may have on our agriculture communities and economy. I share their concerns, as the turbines will be in close proximity to the Niagara Falls Air Reserve Station (NFARS) and may interfere with the base’s radar systems and disrupt daily operations. I applaud the efforts of Save Ontario Shores to ensure there is a mechanism in place for out-of-state clean energy companies to address the concerns of our local farmers, business owners, and elected officials prior to the installation of any wind turbines in our region.   http://orleanshub.com/save-ontario-shores-leaders-tell-town-officials-across-ny-to-be-wary-of-state-control-over-local-decisions/

Congratulations to the Hamilton family on having their farm, Triple H Farms, recognized as Livingston County’s Farm of the Year. Located on 1,100 acres of land in Geneseo and Leicester, Triple H Farms has successfully implemented strong agri-business practices while remaining actively involved in the communities throughout Livingston County. I wish the Hamilton family continued success in the future.   http://www.thelcn.com/lcn01/geneseos-triple-h-named-farm-of-the-year-20170222

I had a great time meeting Dorothy Menke, of Orchard Park, last week at her 100th birthday celebration. Dorothy was in good spirits, surrounded by her closest friends and four generations of the Menke family to celebrate this important milestone. I wish Dorothy all the best in the many healthy years ahead of her.   To see more pictures from Dorothy’s 100th birthday celebration, please visit our Flickr page: https://flic.kr/s/aHskSrhHhG.

The International Joint Commission (IJC) has conceded it’s own Plan 2014 will cause $2 million in damages along the Lake Ontario coastline each year, and local residents are concerned the plan will negatively impact the viability of shoreline businesses as well. The IJC is legally required to provide this compensation to the affected counties, but at this time there are no funds available to ensure this obligation is met. I have been adamantly opposed to Plan 2014 since it was introduced, and considering the IJC has no idea how it will fund the damages it’s own plan will cause, I am hopeful the current administration will oppose this disastrous plan as well.   http://www.whec.com/news/lake-ontario-on-the-rise/4410738/

Throughout “Developmental Disabilities Awareness Month,” please join me in recognizing the organizations throughout New York’s 27th Congressional District that are committed to providing habilitation programs, family support, and job training services to the men and women in our communities who are living with developmental disabilities. I’ll be meeting with advocates from the Livingston-Wyoming ARC in Washington in a few weeks to ensure their voices are heard and they are provided the support they need to live their lives to the fullest. I am proud to be an advocate for the 7 million Americans and their families who are affected by developmental disabilities throughout the country.  http://www.thelcn.com/lcn02/livingston-county-declares-march-is-developmental-disabilities-awareness-month-20170227

Throughout WNY, Orleans County is renowned as one of the best locations for businesses to grow—a strong testament to the tremendous work of Orleans County’s EDA. The Medina Business Park is a perfect representation of the EDA’s willingness to work with business of all sizes and industries to offer more job opportunities in Western New York. I look forward to partnering with the Orleans County EDA in the future to attract new businesses and help local businesses expand.   https://orleanshub.com/orleans-eda-promotes-300-acre-site-in-medina-as-largest-certified-shovel-ready-business-park-in-wny/

I am pleased to announce that this spring will mark the 35th annual Congressional Art Competition for high school students across the nation. Each year, the Congressional Art Competition gives high school students from throughout New York’s 27th Congressional District an opportunity to showcase their extraordinary and wide-ranging artistic talents. One winner will win a trip to Washington, D.C. where their artwork will be proudly displayed in the United States Capitol for one year. I hope all interested high school students participate, and I look forward to seeing this year’s submissions. For more information on the 2017 Congressional Art Competition, please visit my website.   https://chriscollins.house.gov/services/art-competition

I am thrilled with President Trump’s Executive Order to review the disastrous Waters of the United States (WOTUS) rule. This EPA rule has been a blatant federal government overreach since it was established under the Clean Water Act (CWA). When I visit with the hardworking farmers throughout Western New York, I’m constantly told about the devastating impact this regulation has had on their livelihoods. I look forward to this regulatory assault on our nation’s farmers being repealed once and for all.   http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/28/517016071/trump-aims-to-eliminate-clean-water-rule

Americans across the country last night witnessed a leader committed to restoring American greatness. This past November, voters elected a change agent. In his first 40 days in office, President Trump is already delivering the results Americans, especially those in my district of Western New York, have demanded. Whether it’s fighting to return American jobs stolen by countries like Mexico and China, or securing our porous borders, President Trump has shown the world he is a president of action.   If we are going to restore the hope of the American Dream for our children and grandchildren, tough choices need to be made. Unlike our last president, President Trump acknowledged that reality, and outlined a clear vision for us to overcome the challenges we will face. We are going to fight for the American worker, respect the rule of law, and harness the endless potential all Americans possess.   I look forward to President Trump implementing the change Western New Yorkers voted for, and will continue to fight here in Congress for policies that improve the lives of my constituents.

Over $1.03 million will be allocated to Wyoming County to help the Towns of Pike, Orangeville, Wethersfield, Genesee Falls, and Eagle acquire broadband access. This funding will be allocated from the $170 million in federal broadband funding that I fought to secure for New York State. This money will ensure all residents, especially those living in a rural community, will have access to high-speed Internet. This is great news for Wyoming County and is a great start to ensuring all of New York State has high-speed Internet access.   http://www.thedailynewsonline.com/bdn01/five-wyoming-county-towns-to-receive-103-million-for-broadband-investment-20170301

We’ll never fail to remember the courageous women from Western New York who were instrumental in the women’s suffrage movement. Throughout Women’s History Month, please join me in celebrating the vital role women have played in American history.

Proud to see NYS Senator Rob Ortt introducing legislation to repeal provisions of the SAFE Act outside of the New York City area. The SAFE Act has been a blatant infringement on our 2nd Amendment rights since it was signed into law in 2013. Senator Ortt makes a great point—we’ve seen minimum wage and ride-sharing regulations tailored for NYC area-residents; why can’t we show the law-abiding gun owners of Western New York the same respect with regards to the SAFE Act?   http://www.niagara-gazette.com/news/local_news/local-lawmakers-press-for-repeal-of-gun-control-law/article_499e9496-d09b-555e-b0a5-424866b52c77.html

Helping constituents resolve issues with federal agencies is one of my office's main priorities. For residents of the 27th District, my office is available to help you with veterans issues, assistance obtaining visas, determining your Social Security benefits and Medicare eligibility, and much more. Please visit my website or call either of my district offices to learn more about how we can assist you.   https://chriscollins.house.gov/services/help-with-a-federal-agency

These despicable acts of racism and hate have no place in our local communities. I second Pastor Andzel’s call for our community to come together to denounce these hateful acts and show each member of our community the love and respect they deserve. At the end of the day, we are all Americans.   http://buffalonews.com/2017/03/04/racist-graffiti-mars-church-owned-building-genesee-county/

It was a great weekend in New York’s 27th Congressional District. I joined Cub Scout Troop 514 at their Blue & Gold dinner in East Aurora to meet some of our region’s future leaders and hear about their work in our communities. I also attended Wyoming County’s 10th annual “Pride of Wyoming County Agriculture” dinner to celebrate and recognize the hardworking farmers and agri-business leaders throughout the County. Congratulations to these young Scouts and the Wyoming County agriculture community on another successful and prosperous year.

Last month, I sent a letter to Department of Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly outlining my concerns regarding the implementation of a biometric exit-entry system on the U.S.-Canadian Border. While keeping our communities safe is my number one priority, I wanted to ensure that before this system was implemented, we examined all possible transportation impacts to alleviate any disruptions that may be created. I am happy to see the new executive order on immigration signed by President Trump yesterday addresses my concerns while refining its core principles of increased screenings for individuals entering our country.  http://buffalonews.com/2017/03/07/trump-curtails-call-biometrics-border/

Obamacare was sold on empty promises and left the American people with higher premiums, limited choice, and lower-quality health care options. The American people deserve a health care plan that delivers on its promises. The American Health Care Act will provide consumers with lower health care costs, more choices, and will restore healthcare decision making back to the patient—not the federal government. The American Health Care Act will provide a transition period to ensure no one has the rug pulled out from under them and will cover people with pre-existing conditions.

With recent reports speculating that President Trump’s budget proposal will include cuts to the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative, it is important to note that nothing in the President’s budget proposal has been either approved or finalized at this time. I’ve supported increasing Great Lakes Restoration Initiative funding in the past, and I want to assure my constituents that I am monitoring this situation closely.   https://buffalonews.com/2017/03/03/choppy-waters-ahead-great-lakes-restoration/

Under Obamacare, high healthcare costs, sky rocketing premiums, and job-killing regulations have left Western New York families struggling to make ends meet. We must repeal and replace the disaster Obamacare has become for American families. The American Health Care Act will give patients control of their healthcare again and provide Americans with quality, affordable care. Visit www.ReadTheBill.gop to learn more.

On International Women’s Day, we celebrate the important role women have played in spreading democracy and freedom throughout the world. Thank you to the extraordinary women from all walks of life for making our world a better place.

Employment in the private sector last month grew by 298,000—over 100,000 more than anticipated. Consumer confidence continues to grow throughout the country, as lawmakers in Washington focus on cutting burdensome regulations so employers can focus on expanding and hiring more workers. Last month’s private-sector job growth is a clear indication that President Trump and Republicans' pro-growth policies are creating an economic climate suitable for businesses to grow and create good paying job opportunities.   https://www.wsj.com/articles/private-sector-added-more-jobs-than-expected-in-february-1488980927

Over the last two days, I worked for 27 straight hours with my fellow members on the House Energy and Commerce Committee to repeal the Affordable Care Act and advance our legislation that offers a patient-centered approach to healthcare. After a lengthy but thorough markup, we passed legislation that will protect patients with pre-existing conditions, establish a Patient and State Stability Fund, and ensure the future viability of Medicaid so it can protect our most vulnerable.   https://energycommerce.house.gov/news-center/press-releases/energy-and-commerce-committee-advances-legislation-repeal-and-replace

Governor Cuomo and Lt. Governor Kathy Hochul expect counties throughout New York State to continue covering their irresponsible spending on our out of control Medicaid programs. My proposed amendment would require states to cover a county’s Medicaid costs, so counties will no longer have to raise property taxes and cut infrastructure programs to foot the bill for reckless spending of taxpayer dollars. New York State spends 44% more per Medicaid beneficiary per year than the national average; and over $470 million of our state’s Medicaid expenses are covered by counties within New York’s 27th Congressional District, alone. I am proud to have the support of the New York State Association of Counties and will continue fighting to improve Medicaid and ensure its future financial viability.   http://auburnpub.com/blogs/eye_on_ny/nysac-chief-collins-medicaid-proposal-would-benefit-ny-counties/article_9bbf5fec-060f-11e7-8244-0f95c52cb711.html

A major nor’easter is expected to bring significant snow and high-wind conditions into our region over the next few days. National Grid has provided my office with a number of resources and additional information on how to best ensure you are kept safe and are properly prepared. For more information, please visit the link below. I hope everyone stays safe and alert at all times.  https://chriscollins.house.gov/sites/chriscollins.house.gov/files/National_Grid.pdf

Michael Paduchak spent his entire life serving his country and community. He served in the U.S. Army during WWII from 1944-1946, was the Kendall Town Supervisor for 32 years, and was an active member of the Kendall Fire Department for over 50 years.  Michael passed away on January 31, 2017. It was an honor to have been joined by his daughter, Nadine Hanlon, to recognize Michael as my office’s Veteran of the Month and celebrate his lifelong service to the Kendall community. We are greatly indebted to Michael, and I am proud to see Nadine carry out his legacy of community and public service each day as Clerk of the Orleans County Legislature. Thank you to Michael and all of our nation’s veterans for defending our country and protecting the freedoms we enjoy each day as Americans.    https://orleanshub.com/michael-paduchak-served-his-country-long-after-wwii/

My proposed amendment will hold states, like New York, accountable for their reckless spending on Medicaid programs that have burdened taxpayers and counties throughout the country. Each year, New York State’s out of control Medicaid programs costs Erie County residents more than $200 million—nearly equal to how much the county brings in through property taxes according to Comptroller Stefan Mychajliw. Bringing an end to this unfunded mandate will help counties lower property taxes and develop local infrastructure that will improve the quality of life for local residents.   http://www.twcnews.com/nys/buffalo/politics/2017/03/13/comptroller-says-without-medicaid-burden-erie-county-could-feasibly-stop-taxing-homeowners.html

As one of only eight Members of Congress serving on the House Energy and Commerce Medicaid Task-Force, I’m working to ensure Medicaid is focused on helping our most vulnerable—adults with income either at or below the federal poverty line, children, pregnant women, elderly adults, and people with disabilities. Under Obamacare, Medicaid eligibility was expanded to provide coverage for able-bodied, working adults earning up to 138% of the federal poverty level—drastically altering the original intent of the Medicaid program. As a member of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, I’m working to ensure the American Health Care Act (ACHA) responsibly unwinds Obamacare’s Medicaid expansion, returns the focus of Medicaid back to those it was intended to help, and ensures we can protect current Medicaid expansion enrollees. President Trump’s budget delivered a clear vision for the role the federal government should play. It demonstrates that President Trump is committed to keeping the promises he made to the American people. He will rebuild our military. The budget’s $54 billion increase in defense spending is much needed, and I fully support the increase in military funding. Additionally, President Trump promised to secure our borders, and this budget lays the groundwork for building a wall and taking the necessary steps to ensure our nation’s border security.   However, I have several concerns about significant cuts to local programs, which I believe go too far. I worked for more than two years to help write and pass the 21st Century Cures Initiative, and I fully believe that the funding guidelines established in that legislation must be followed. The $5.8 billion cut to NIH is drastic. Yesterday I recognized U.S. Air Force veteran and Bloomfield resident, Richard Lucas, as my office’s Veteran of the Month. Mr. Lucas joined the Army Air Corps in 1942, and served in the U.S. Air Force as an aircraft repairman from its establishment in 1947 until he retired in September 1964. During World War II, Mr. Lucas was sent overseas during the Occupation of Germany to assist with the transfer over 1,500 Prisoners of War. Mr. Lucas continued to serve in the U.S. Air Force during both the Korean and Vietnam wars. At 95 years of age, Mr. Lucas still serves as the Commander of the Honeoye-Hemlock American Legion Post #1278. Mr. Lucas is a true patriot, and we owe him a tremendous debt of gratitude for his service to our nation.   To nominate a NY-27 “Veteran of the Month,” please submit an inquiry to NY27Veteran@mail.house.gov.

52 of my colleagues and I sent a letter to Office of Management and Budget Director Mick Mulvaney urging him to allocate robust funding in the President’s FY19 budget to address toxic algae blooms. Almost every state is affected by toxic algae blooms, which can be harmful to human health by impacting drinking water or the seafood we consume, and by discouraging tourism. In order to continue to protect the communities around the Finger Lakes and other bodies of water, I support greater investments into science and research to determine how to lessen the impact of toxic algae blooms.  To read the letter, click here: http://bit.ly/2BuElrP

Brownfields are abandoned, closed, or under-utilized sites that can be an environmental and social drain on a community. Today the House passed H.R. 3017, Brownfields Enhancement, Economic Redevelopment, and Reauthorization Act. This legislation reauthorizes and makes improvements to the EPA Brownfields Program that helps in redeveloping these properties, which creates jobs and protects the environment. Use this map shows how many of these sites are in the 27th District of New York. http://bit.ly/2zBJ1e6

Today the House passed legislation that that would make concealed-carry permits valid across state lines. This is a simple, common-sense bill that protects the Second Amendment rights of law-abiding citizens. I believe in the natural right to self-defense, just like our Founding Fathers, and today’s vote protects these freedoms. Varying state laws can confuse citizens who may unknowingly violate a law when traveling from state to state. This legislation treats a concealed-carry permit like a driver’s license, protecting the constitutional rights of all Americans.

The FAA released its beta test of FAA’s online Pilot Records Database (PRD). The PRD will expedite the sharing of pilot records to help commercial airlines and operators make informed hiring decisions. I commend the families of Flight 3407 that worked tirelessly to get this important measure put in place. This database will not only create a more accurate and efficient way of checking pilot records, but will keep our skies safer.   https://chriscollins.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/faa-releases-beta-test-of-online-pilot-records-database
